definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: And Rehoboam rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 羅波安與他列祖同睡，葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

sentences.english: He died and was buried with his fathers in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 衆人將他葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

sentences.english: It is a post-medieval disused burial ground in London, England.
sentences.chinese: 這是英格蘭倫敦後中世紀的廢棄墳地。

sentences.english: He kidnaps the Earth from his children, and he does not care.
sentences.chinese: 他無視於祖先的墳地，他不在乎。

sentences.english: Then Jehoshaphat rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 約沙法與他列祖同睡，葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

sentences.english: Jehoram rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 約蘭與他列祖同睡，葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

sentences.english: Ahaz rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 亞哈斯與他列祖同睡，葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

sentences.english: Azariah rested with his fathers and was buried near them in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 亞撒利雅與他列祖同睡，葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

sentences.english: Ask him to sell it to me for the full price as a burial site among you.
sentences.chinese: 他可以按着足價賣給我，作我在你們中間的墳地。

sentences.english: Bury the dead for fear that they walk to the grave ln labour.
sentences.chinese: 埋葬死者以免她們在分娩中步向墳地。

sentences.english: However, a fine can make such burial sites legal.
sentences.chinese: 不過交了罰款後，這些墳地可以變成合法。

sentences.english: And Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David.
sentences.chinese: 羅波安與他列祖同睡，葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

definition: to pile up like a mountain (idiom)/a mountain of (paperwork etc)/a large number of sth
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
yaodong (a kind of cave dwelling in the Loess Plateau in northwest China)/CL:孔[kong3]
to plan a military mission on a sand table (idiom)/to rehearse a planned action or activity/to conduct a dry run
Kenting National Park on the Hengchun Peninsula 恆春半島|恒春半岛[Heng2 chun1 Ban4 dao3], Pingtung county, south Taiwan
pinyin: Ken3 ding1 Guo2 jia1 Gong1 yuan2
